intro: Palala globularia, commonly known as the globe-shaped lichen, is a unique species characterized by its spherical growth form. It belongs to the family Lecanoraceae and is primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant forms a dense, crust-like structure on rocks and tree bark, often appearing as a compact, rounded mass. Its thallus is typically composed of a mixture of photobionts and fungal hyphae, contributing to its ecological resilience. The botanical features of Palala globularia make it an important indicator species for assessing environmental conditions in its habitat.
